Please send us your comments and feedback
How easy to use mUzima App?
The feature utilizes the OpenMRS Reporting Module to design and generate HTML reports that are then rendered on the app.
This feature allows for the management of different patient or client groups on a mobile device.
mUzima uses easy-to-develop web-based forms to collect data that can easily be transmitted and stored in OpenMRS.
mUzima prevents duplicate form data entry on mobile device and resolves errors in OpenMRS during data processing.
mUzima enables easy download and update of new forms onto the app without the need for reinstalling or restarting the app.
Brings in the ability to easily capture and record patient GPS coordinates, then give CHVs direction on subsequent visits.
mUzima has easy and efficient user-friendly mechanisms for retrieving and viewing historical data on patients or clients.
mUzima is easily customizable to support any clinical use cases, both within and outside of clinical facilities.
mUzima provides localisation support out of the box for use in various languages to allow further flexibility of use.
mUzima is shipped on two themes: dark theme (White on Black) and Light theme (Black on white).
mUzima was designed to be the mHealth extension of OpenMRS. OpenMRS is deployed nationally in several countries.
Missing registration form. Please contact administrator
In the healthcare space, a relationship is used to pair/associate two people whose care may be inter-linked.
mUzima provides security features including password login, encryption, secure data transmission, timed user logouts.
mUzima sync service is already running…
mUzima works perfectly both in online and offline modes. This allows for data collection and reviews even when the device is offline.

mUzima for Health Providers app (the "Application") is built as an Open Source end-user app and is provided by Moi University and Vanderbilt University Medical Center (collectively, "We," "Us" or "Our") at no cost and is intended for use as is. If you ("You","Your") are using our application for an organization, you\’re agreeing to these Terms and Conditions on behalf of that organization. If you\’re using our application to provide services for someone else, you\’re agreeing to these Terms and conditions on their behalf. Your use of the application is also subject to the PRIVACY POLICY ("Privacy Policy") and any applicable open source or other third party terms referenced below (the "Third Party Terms"). IF YOU ARE AN INDIVIDUAL REPRESENTING AN ENTITY, YOU ACKNOWLEDGE THAT YOU HAVE THE APPROPRIATE AUTHORITY TO ACCEPT THIS AGREEMENT ON BEHALF OF SUCH ENTITY.

To the extent of an inconsistency or conflict between this Agreement and any Third Party Terms, the Third Party Terms shall control for purposes of the applicable Third Party Element(s).


3. Disclaimer; Limitation of Liability. 
This application is distributed under the terms of the Mozilla Public License, v. 2.0 (MPL 2.0) (http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/). The following additional disclaimer of warranty and limitation of liability are hereby incorporated into the terms and conditions of MPL 2.0: 
NO WARRANTIES OF ANY KIND WHATSOEVER ARE MADE AS TO THE RESULTS THAT YOU WILL OBTAIN FROM RELYING UPON THE COVERED APPLICATION (OR ANY INFORMATION OR CONTENT OBTAINED BY WAY OF THE COVERED CODE), INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO COMPLIANCE WITH PRIVACY LAWS OR REGULATIONS OR CLINICAL CARE INDUSTRY STANDARDS AND PROTOCOLS. USE OF THE COVERED APPLICATION IS NOT A SUBSTITUTE FOR A HEALTH CARE PROVIDER’S STANDARD PRACTICE OR PROFESSIONAL JUDGMENT. ANY DECISION WITH REGARD TO THE APPROPRIATENESS OF TREATMENT, OR THE VALIDITY OR RELIABILITY OF INFORMATION OR CONTENT MADE AVAILABLE BY THE COVERED CODE, IS THE SOLE RESPONSIBILITY OF THE HEALTH CARE PROVIDER. CONSEQUENTLY, IT IS INCUMBENT UPON EACH HEALTH CARE PROVIDER TO VERIFY ALL MEDICAL HISTORY AND TREATMENT PLANS WITH EACH PATIENT.


UNDER NO CIRCUMSTANCES AND UNDER NO LEGAL THEORY, WHETHER TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE), CONTRACT, OR OTHERWISE, SHALL ANY CONTRIBUTOR, OR ANYONE WHO DISTRIBUTES COVERED SOFTWARE AS PERMITTED BY THE LICENSE, BE LIABLE TO YOU FOR ANY INDIRECT, SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL, CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES OF ANY CHARACTER INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, DAMAGES FOR LOSS OF GOODWILL, WORK STOPPAGE, COMPUTER FAILURE OR MALFUNCTION, OR ANY AND ALL OTHER DAMAGES OR LOSSES, OF ANY NATURE WHATSOEVER (DIRECT OR OTHERWISE) ON ACCOUNT OF OR ASSOCIATED WITH THE USE OR INABILITY TO USE THE COVERED CONTENT (INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, THE USE OF INFORMATION OR CONTENT MADE AVAILABLE BY THE COVERED CODE, ALL DOCUMENTATION ASSOCIATED THEREWITH, AND THE FAILURE OF THE COVERED CODE TO COMPLY WITH PRIVACY LAWS AND REGULATIONS OR CLINICAL CARE INDUSTRY STANDARDS AND PROTOCOLS), EVEN IF SUCH PARTY SHALL HAVE BEEN INFORMED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES.


4. Revision of Terms.

All revised Terms are automatically effective as soon as they are posted or provided. Your continued use of the application constitutes your agreement to be bound by the revised Terms.

You have been switched from the offline mode to online mode. While on online mode, all patient data will be deleted from your device when you log out or you are auto logged out.

mUzima is a mobile application that enables health professionals collect, manage and use healthcare data as an extension to the OpenMRS medical record system. The app is built as an open source end user application, which is provided at no cost, and is intended for use as is. If you're using the application for an organization, you're agreeing to this Privacy Policy on behalf of that organization. If you're using the application to provide services, software and content for someone else, you're agreeing to this Privacy Policy on their behalf. 
IF YOU OR THE ORGANIZATION YOU REPRESENT DOES NOT AGREE TO BE BOUND TO THIS PRIVACY POLICY, YOU SHOULD NOT USE THE MOBILE APPLICATION.


Third party services 
The application uses third-party services that may collect information used to identify you. The third party service providers used by the app are: 
Google Play Services: The mUzima mobile application is built to run on the Android Operating system and is primarily distributed via theGoogle playstore. For this reason, your use of the mUzima mobile application is bound by the Google privacy policy with the use of Google services on the Android platform, that is available here: https://www.google.com/policies/privacy/ 
Firebase Crashlytics and analytics: In case of an error in the app, such as the application crashing, we collect data and information (through third-party products) on your phone called Crashlytics data. This Crashlytics data may include information such as device name, operating system version, the configuration of the app when utilizing our application, as well as the time and date of your use of the application. Other data that could be collected depending on your settings include location information. The use of the mUzima mobile application is therefore bound by the Firebase privacy policy available here: https://firebase.google.com/support/privacy.


Cookies 
Cookies are files with a small amount of data that are commonly used as anonymous unique identifiers. These are sent to your browser from the websites that you visit and are stored on your device's internal memory.


mUzima app does not use these "cookies" explicitly. However, the app may use third party code and libraries that use "cookies" to collect information and improve their services. You have the option to either accept or refuse these cookies and know when a cookie is being sent to your device. If you choose to refuse the cookies, you may not be able to use some portions of this Service.


Location Data 
mUzima mobile application comes with optional features that may need access to the precise or approximate location of the device. The features are: 
Recording patient address: 
GPS addresses of patients may be stored as part of information stored in the secure OpenMRS medical record system. mUzima provides the ability to set the address of a patient record, so as to update the record in the OpenMRS medical record system. 
Navigating to the patient’s address: 
mUzima provides the Geomapping feature to enable the user/provider to get directions (via Google maps app on Android device) to the patient's GPS location as indicated by the medical record.


The GPS location information collected via the mobile application is purely for the features localized within the implementation and will in no way be shared with mUzima or any third party. The application may use the location information if you grant it the permissions to do so. You can enable or disable location services when you use our application at any time, through your device settings. Your implementation administrator can enable or disable the optional features that need location data via the application settings. 
A link to a video that demonstrates the mUzima’s GPS features can be found here: 
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1CiiP6xodoQ55FMJZwBFdnYEhTbP1_jM4/view?usp=sharing.


Security 
We value your trust in our application. But remember that no method of transmission over the internet, or method of electronic storage is 100% secure and reliable, and we cannot guarantee its absolute security.

Please be aware that certain Personal Information and other information provided by you in connection with your use of the application may be stored on your device (even if we do not collect that information). You are solely responsible for maintaining the security of your device from unauthorized access.


Changes to This Privacy Policy 
We may update our Privacy Policy from time to time. Thus, you are advised to review this page periodically for any changes. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page. These changes are effective immediately after they are posted on this page.


Contact Us 
If you have any questions or suggestions about our Privacy Policy, do not hesitate to contact us through mUzima.mobile@gmail.com
